intro: Echinocactus ottonis, commonly known as the golden barrel cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stem covered in prominent, spiny areoles. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom at the top of the stem, typically in the spring. Its structure is adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant. The species is popular in horticulture due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
